Module WitchHunt
Package fr.sos.witchhunt.model.players.cpustrategies

Class GropingStrategy

java.lang.Object
fr.sos.witchhunt.model.players.cpustrategies.CPUStrategy
fr.sos.witchhunt.model.players.cpustrategies.GropingStrategy
All Implemented Interfaces:
PlayStrategy
public final class GropingStrategy extends CPUStrategy
The initial strategy of all CPU-controlled players, and the one adopted when the situation is not clear enough to choose a more angular strategy.

Most choices are done randomly.

Tries keeping the best cards (in terms of overall value) for the end of the round.

A witch using this strategy witch will never reveal their identity unless they have no more playable Witch? effects in their hand.

See Also:

  • Method Details

    • selectIdentity

      public Identity selectIdentity()

      Chooses an identity.

      VILLAGER is more suited for a player with an aggressive playstyle, while WITCH corresponds better to a player with a defensive or careful playstyle

      This strategy will select an identity randomly. WITCH and VILLAGER have the same chances to be chosen.
      Returns:
      Either VILLAGER or WITCH.
      See Also:
      • Identity
      • CPUPlayer::chooseIdentity()

    • selectPlayerToAccuse

      public Player selectPlayerToAccuse(List<Player> accusablePlayersList)

      Selects a player to accuse within a list.

      This strategy will select a random player to accuse.
      Parameters:
      accusablePlayersList - The list within which a player must be accused
      Returns:
      The chosen target
      See Also:
      • Player.accuse(Player)

    • selectNextPlayer

      public Player selectNextPlayer(List<Player> list)

      Selects a player to take the next turn.

      Most strategies will avoid giving the next turn to the leading players.

      This strategy will select a random player to take the next turn.
      Parameters:
      list - A list of players within which the next player has to be selected.
      Returns:
      The chosen player to take the next turn.
      See Also:
      • CPUPlayer::chooseNextPlayer()

    • selectWitchCard

      public RumourCard selectWitchCard(RumourCardsPile rcp)
      Selects a Rumour card valued for its Witch? effect within a given pile of Rumour cards. With this strategy, the player keeps the best witch effects for the end of the round, in the event that they can decide soon for a more defined strategy.
      Parameters:
      rcp - The pile of Rumour cards within which the choice can be made.
      Returns:
      A random card among the ones with the lowest Witch? effect value and the lowest overall value.
      See Also:
      • CardValueMap.getCardsWithMinWitchValue(RumourCardsPile)
      • CardValueMap.getCardsWithMinOverallValue(RumourCardsPile)

    • selectHuntCard

      public RumourCard selectHuntCard(RumourCardsPile rcp)
      Selects a Rumour card valued for its Hunt! effect within a given pile of Rumour cards. Default definition of what is the best Hunt! card to play for a strategy. This strategy will select a random card with a positive value for its Hunt! effect.
      Specified by:
      selectHuntCard in interface PlayStrategy
      Overrides:
      selectHuntCard in class CPUStrategy
      Parameters:
      rcp - The pile of Rumour cards within which the choice can be made.
      Returns:
      The card with the best Hunt! effect value within the given deck.
      See Also:
      • CardValueMap.getCardsWithMaxHuntValue(RumourCardsPile)
